text: Maurice Le Guilloux (born 14 May 1950) is a former French racing cyclist. He rode in eleven Grand Tours between 1975 and 1984. He spent much of his career as a domestique for fellow Breton cyclist Bernard Hinault and subsequently became a directeur sportif at La Vie Claire. However Le Guilloux and Hinault's friendship was damaged by the events of the 1986 Tour de France, where Le Guilloux was the directeur sportif responsible for Hinault's rival and team- mate at La Vie Claire, Greg LeMond. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1950 births Category:Living people Category:French male cyclists Category:Sportspeople from Côtes-d'Armor Category:Tour de France cyclists Category:Giro d'Italia cyclists Category:Vuelta a España cyclists
title: Maurice Le Guilloux
